results.title: Dark passage
results.creator_credit: Delmer Daves, Jerry Wald, First National Pictures and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Vincent Parry’s been framed! Wrongly convicted of murdering his wife, Parry (Bogart) busts out of San Quentin and heads for San Francisco, determined to clear himself. Once there, he takes shelter with Irene Jansen (Bacall), a young woman who believes his story and wants to help. Undergoing extensive plastic surgery, Parry drastically changes his appearance, but not his mission. Hidden by his new face, he evades blackmailer’s double-crossers and the cops in a final, desperate effort to find the real killer… before the killer finds him.

results.title: Open city = Rome, open city = Roma, citta aperta
results.brief_description: Alongside de Sica’s “The Bicycle Thieves”, this film is the definitive work of Italian neo-realist cinema. “Rome Open City” follows the activities of the Resistance in the last days of the German Occupation. Many of the cast were active in the Resistance and the filming was done on street locations in Rome immediately after the Liberation. Rossellini spoke of wishing to “capture the fleeting reflection of appearances … All the action is seen from the outside, objectively”. In this feature he laid the ground rules for neo-realism: non-professional actors, hand held film-work, non-studio sets. The result is a film of uncompromising commitment to detailing the struggles of ordinary people to make sense of their everyday lives amid the brutality of war. In hindsight, some of the narrative might appear sentimental. The attempt by neo-realists to create an “objective cinema” was never to be fully achieved: the authorial voices of director and script-writer were to remain crucial in defining reality. But Rosselini’s film still manages, decades on, to convey the textures, sounds and sights of war and human endurance: some of the images remain unforgettable. Co-scripted by a young Federico Fellini.

results.title: Operating under pressure
results.creator_credit: John Richardson, Victorian Pipelines Commission and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: Construction of the 108-mile pipeline conveying natural gas from Dutson to Dandenong, Victoria. Shows manufacture, welding, testing and laying pipes, discussing problems encountered, and the final turning on of gas.

results.title: Opera school
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Shows how a young singer during three years at the opera school of the Royal Conservatory of Music, Toronto, prepares for an operatic career. The film follows the progress of Marie Burton (played by Marguerite Gignac) from the time she first appears for audition until she rises to a leading role in the annual opera festival. The enthusiastic dedication to music by the youghful aspirants is caught by the camera, in school and out. Excerpts from operas are heard throughout the film, and the final section presents part of a full-dress performance of Mozart’s “The Marriage of Figaro” in English.

results.title: Op hop, op hop
results.creator_credit: Pierre Heberrt and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A hand-made, scratched-on film experiment in intermittent animation. The images are a group of twenty-four visuals, all non-representational, which arrange and rearrange on the screen in many combinations. The result is a changing pattern of sound and image that has its own rhythm for eye and ear.

results.title: Opera favourites with Placido Domingo and Kiri Te Kanawa
results.brief_description: Te Kanawa and Domingo are two names which rank amongst the most illustious in the world of opera. Both singers bring consummate skill and artistry to their individual performances, but together they form a partnership which is perfectly balanced, achieving a musical and dramatic rapport. All the exceptional musical and dramatic qualities Te Kanawa and Domingo command can be seen and heard in these magnificent performances. Selections are from; Die Fledermaus, The tales of Hoffmann, Agnes Baltsa, La faniciulladel West, Otello, Ernani, Manon Lescaut.

results.title: Only when I laugh
results.creator_credit: Glenn Jordan, Neil Simon, Roger M Rothstein and Colubia Pictures Industries
results.brief_description: A bittersweet Neil Simon comedy about alcoholic Broadway actress, Georgia Hines’ (Marsha Mason), struggle to remain sober and who six years earlier relinquished custody of her daughter Polly (Kristy McNichol) in order to “straighten out her life.” Georgia is about to star in a play about her turbulent romantic past, when Polly decides to move in. There are good times, pretending to be sisters to confuse a pair of college boys, and there are tough times, when they confront the past and the truth about the lost years. Through it all, with humour and warmth, they come to know one another again. Superior performances by James Coco as a gay failed actor, Joan Hackett as an aging Park Avenue beauty, Georgia’s “perennially out-of-work” friends, and David Dukes as boyfriend David. Screenplay by Neil Simon, loosley based on his play “The Gingerbread Lady.”

results.title: Only two wheels
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Terry Jennings and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Emphasizing the importance of motor cycle riders seeing and being seen, this film highlights a variety of problems that normally confront the motor cyclist - lane changing, hazards on the road, car blind spots, careless pedestrians and emergency braking.

results.title: Opens Wednesday
results.creator_credit: Barrie Nelson and Barrie Nelson Productions
results.brief_description: Opens Wednesday is a romp through a director’s rehearsal of a lively animated show. Nelson’s animated transformations are intimate and spectacular. Partial funding by the American Film Institute and National Endowment for the Arts.

results.title: Open your eyes = Abre los ojos
results.creator_credit: Alejandro Amenabar, Jose Luis Cuerda, Fernando Bovaira, Sociedad General de Television SA, Lucky Red, Les Films Alain Sarde and Producciones del Escorpión S.L.
results.brief_description: Cesar (Eduardo Noriega) is a very handsome young man and an heir to a huge family fortune. At a party he meets Sofia (Penelope Cruz) and for the first time in his life, he feels love. However, his jealous girlfriend causes a horrific accident which leaves Cesar mutilated, his once beautiful face now disfigured. Furthermore, the accident seems to have thrown Cesar into a nightmare world in which he is accused of murder and one from which he is unable to escape. Told in flashback by Cesar who is being held in a prison for the mentally insane, “Open your eyes” is by turns a horror film, a love story, and a metaphysical puzzle which plays with our notions of beauty, faith and truth. Cameron Crowe remade “Open your eyes” as the Hollywood film, “Vanilla sky”. In Spanish with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alejandro Amenabar, Jose Luis Cuerda, Fernando Bovaira, Sociedad General de Television SA, Lucky Red, Les Films Alain Sarde and Producciones del Escorpión S.L.
